meanings.definition: To criticize or mock through satire.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys satirising politicians in her comedy sketches.
meanings.sent2: The comedian is satirising current events in his latest stand-up routine.
meanings.sent3: The satirising of the absurdity in the movie had the audience laughing out loud.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp wit when satirising societal norms cuts through the noise.
meanings.sent5: The cartoonist is known for satirising serious topics with humor and insight.

meanings.definition: The act of using satire to criticize or mock.
meanings.sent1: Satirising can be a powerful tool for social commentary.
meanings.sent2: The satirising in the play highlighted the flaws in the system.
meanings.sent3: The clever satirising in the book made readers think about important issues.
meanings.sent4: His satirising of the political landscape was both bold and thought-provoking.
meanings.sent5: The magazine's satirising of celebrities was both entertaining and enlightening.
